title: ‘Accident’ that wasn’t: Bengaluru techie crashes SUV twice to finish off friend
description: A drunken argument between friends escalated into a brutal murder in Electronics City. Roshan Hegde, a software engineer, intentionally crashed his SUV twice, killing his friend Prashanth M who was clinging to the vehicle. Dashcam footage revealed the deliberate act, initially mistaken for a road accident. The dispute stemmed from a cricket match and alcohol consumption.

title: Gurgaon abduction: Woman dragged into Scorpio at 3am, rescued after vehicle gets stuck in mud
description: In a shocking incident in Gurgaon, a 23-year-old woman was forcibly taken by a food vendor named Gaurav Bhati from Leopard Trail, who then tried to flee in a Scorpio. As the police launched a high-speed chase across the city, Bhati eventually abandoned the vehicle after it became immobilized. He was apprehended shortly after the attempted escape.

title: Kedarnath, Badrinath and 47 affiliated temples considering a ban on entry of non-Hindus
description: Following a proposal to restrict non-Hindus at Haridwar's Kumbh ghats, the Badrinath Kedarnath Temple Committee is considering a similar move at its shrines. Citing tradition and constitutional rights, the committee chairman stated the decision aims to preserve religious practices, welcoming those who respect their faith.

title: Reviewer burnout drives AI use yet human oversight remains crucial
description: In 2020, peer reviewers worldwide dedicated approximately 130 million hours to review work, according to Deeksha Gupta, director, global strategy for society programmes at the American Chemical Society. This poses an immense burden to reviewers who must balance reviewing with their own academic and research commitments

title: Fisherfolk oppose Mamallan Reservoir project at Gram Sabhas
description: According to a community leader, people from Kanathur Reddikuppam, Kovalam, and Nemmeli submitted petitions stating that their livelihoods would be lost if the reservoir is established

title: Three arrested for selling manja thread, kites
description: Inquiry reveals that the accused had been procuring kites and bundles of manja thread from Andhra Pradesh and selling them locally

title: Inclusive sports meet held
description: The sports meet featured a range of adaptive sports, including sitting volleyball and track-and-field events

title: 'Border 2' crosses 200 crore mark, earned Rs 56 crore on Monday
description: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' has set the box office ablaze with its staggering opening, surpassing Rs 50 crore on Monday alone. Riding high on the Republic Day weekend momentum, the film has not only achieved exemplary daily earnings but also amassed a colossal net of Rs 177 crore in just four days.

title: On Padma rolls is man who 'exposed' UPA on Ishrat Jahan case
description: A former MHA officer, RVS Mani, instrumental in exposing contradictory affidavits in the Ishrat Jahan case, has been honored with the Padma Shri. Mani claimed political interference led to the revision of the initial affidavit, which cited intelligence reports confirming Jahan's terror links. The second affidavit downplayed the intelligence, a move later confirmed by then Home Minister Rajnath Singh.

title: Delhi Confidential: Republic Day Appearance
Mass killing of stray dogs continues: 200 more killed in Telangana, toll crosses 1,000 in a month
description: Hundreds of stray dogs were allegedly poisoned to death in Telangana's Hanumakonda district, marking the second mass killing reported this month. Animal rights activists suspect a connection to recent village elections, with officials possibly fulfilling poll promises. Authorities are investigating, with plans to exhume carcasses for post-mortem examinations.

title: MS Dhoni starts preparations ahead of IPL; CSK share practice video - Watch
description: MS Dhoni has commenced batting practice for the upcoming IPL season, with CSK sharing a video of his drills. Despite Ruturaj Gaikwad's form, Dhoni remains a key player as CSK targets a sixth title. His role is under scrutiny following a modest 2025 season and the arrival of Sanju Samson.

title: Wrists working, runs flowing — how Suryakumar Yadav found form again
description: Suryakumar Yadav's recent form with two consecutive fifties has silenced doubts ahead of the T20 World Cup. After a lean patch, a crucial innings in Raipur saw him bat with patience, assessing conditions before unleashing his signature strokeplay. This resurgence provides vital reassurance for the Indian team management.

title: Venezuela’s Delcy Rodriguez has capitulated to U.S. pressure: Tariq Ali
Metrowater setting up treatment plants to decentralise supply network in Chennai
description: The agency is constructing plants in Perumbakkam and Mogappair, each with a capacity of treating 10 mld to augment water supply in the city

title: Trump hikes tariffs on South Korea to 25%; cites legislative delay in enacting 'historic' trade deal
description: President Trump announced a 25% tariff hike on South Korean autos, lumber, and pharmaceuticals, citing the nation's legislature for failing to ratify their trade agreement. This move follows previous threats and aims to pressure Seoul to uphold the deal, which includes a $350 billion investment pledge.

title: Uttarakhand implements UCC amendment ordinance
description: Uttarakhandbeen made for the issuance of a termination certificate by the registrar upon the end of a live-in relationship and to replace the term “widow” with “spouse”, officials said.

'United for Kerala elections': Congress leaders likely to meet Shashi Tharoor to settle issues
description: Congress leadership is planning to meet senior leader Shashi Tharoor following his absence from a crucial Kerala election strategy meeting. Tharoor, who cited personal issues and unhappiness with the party, will be invited for discussions to address his grievances. The party aims to ensure unity for the upcoming state elections, recognizing Tharoor's electoral influence.

title: 77th Republic Day: Military might, with a dash of Sindoor
Spouse, not husband: Delhi HC orders district courts to use gender-neutral terms
description: Delhi High Court has adopted gender-neutral terminology in court documents, replacing father's/husband's name with parent's/spouse's name. This change, inspired by a district judge's suggestion, aims to empower women and reflect modern family structures. The move will impact judicial officers' personal files, staff ID cards, and various official forms.

title: Nigerian military officers to face trial over 2025 coup plot
description: No date was given for the trials. The officers could face the death penalty if found guilty, according to legal experts.

title: Kolkata: At least 7 killed, 21 missing in massive warehouse fire; probe underway
description: A devastating fire engulfed a Kolkata warehouse complex early Monday, claiming at least seven lives and leaving 21 workers missing. Trapped inside units laden with combustible decoration materials and food supplies, the victims were sleeping when the blaze erupted. Firefighters battled for hours, but the inferno's intensity and smoldering debris continue to hinder rescue efforts.

title: Venezuela releases dozens of prisoners in 2 days, hundreds more still detained
description: According to human rights groups, prisoners released this weekend included an opposition activist, a human rights lawyer and a journalism student who was imprisoned in March after he published complaints about his hometown’s sewage system and was charged with “inciting hatred.”

title: Indians claim five gold medals in WTT Youth Star Contender
description: Akash Rajavelu and Rishaan Chattopadhyay came first in U-15 boys’ doubles.

'Crimes against humanity': Bangladesh sentences ex-Dhaka police chief, 2 officers to death
description: Former Dhaka police chief and two ex-deputies have been sentenced to death by Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal for crimes against humanity. Convicted in absentia, they were found guilty of leading a brutal crackdown on 2024 protests that led to hundreds of deaths and the ouster of then-PM Sheikh Hasina.

title: Nvidia CEO says 'blue-collar work value will increase': Is AI boom redefining career success?
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang suggests AI will boost blue-collar jobs, challenging traditional career paths.  Historically, advancement meant moving away from hands-on work.  However, the rise of the 'new blue collar' – roles blending physical tasks with AI tools – signifies a shift.  Practical understanding of real-world systems is regaining importance for leadership and career success.

India, EU finalise FTA, deal set to be announced today
description: India and the European Union have finalized a comprehensive free trade agreement after 18 years of talks, poised to boost trade and investment. The deal, expected to be announced Tuesday, aims for significant tariff reductions on most goods, with India gaining market access for textiles and leather, while offering concessions on automobiles and wines. Implementation is anticipated by early 2027.

title: Shedeur Sanders named Pro Bowl replacement QB: Explained
description: Shedeur Sanders has been named to the 2026 Pro Bowl roster. He joins as a replacement quarterback after another player advanced to the Super Bowl. This selection has sparked considerable online discussion. Sanders' rookie season statistics were not considered Pro Bowl caliber. His inclusion highlights the alternate selection process. This marks a significant achievement on his rookie resume.

Cooper Kupp’s wife draws reaction in Seahawks coat
description: Cooper Kupp’s NFC Championship appearance against his former Rams blended football and family into one powerful moment. Now with the Seahawks, the Super Bowl MVP faced his past while drawing strength from his wife Anna and their three sons. The matchup symbolized resilience, loyalty, and a fresh chapter driven by purpose.

title: Travis Kelce romance sparks debate over Taylor Swift’s songwriting
description: Taylor Swift recently admitted she once feared happiness could weaken her songwriting as her romance with Travis Kelce deepened. She worried that joy might replace the emotional tension that fueled her lyrics. However, her latest album proved otherwise, showing she can create vibrant, story-driven music even during one of the happiest chapters of her life.

title: UGC anti-discrimination rules 2026: A bid for inclusion or risk of bias? Explained
description: Heads of universities and colleges are no longer just administrators; they are now the first line of accountability in preventing and responding to discrimination. New structures, new reporting mechanisms, and strict timelines are written into the rulebook, backed by the threat of serious penalties for non-compliance. Yet, as has often been the case with regulations aimed at correcting long-standing social inequities, the real questions lie beneath the stated intent.

title: Infosys to employees: Share data about your electricity bills
description: Infosys is collecting household electricity consumption data from its employees working from home to enhance its sustainability program. This initiative aims to accurately measure the environmental impact of hybrid work and inform future clean energy strategies. The company, a long-time advocate for sustainability, is revalidating its emissions reporting methodology through this employee survey.
